articles.author: SARAH EL DEEB and FATMA KHALED
articles.description: The world’s final glimpse of Hamas’ leader was rough and raw, showing him wounded and cornered as he sat in a bombed-out Palestinian home and faced down the Israeli drone filming him, hurling a stick at it.
articles.title: In Israeli footage of the last minutes of Hamas leader's life, some see a symbol of defiance

articles.author: ADAM SCHRECK and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israel's government said a drone targeted Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s house Saturday, with no casualties, as fighting with Lebanon-based Hezbollah and Gaza -based Hamas showed no pause after the killing of the Hamas mastermind of last year’s Oct.
articles.title: A drone targets the Israeli prime minister's house during new barrages with Hezbollah

articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG and BASSEM MROUE
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Israeli forces have spent much of the past year destroying Hamas’ vast underground network in Gaza.
articles.title: Israel unearths Hezbollah's web of tunnels in southern Lebanon

articles.author: CHRIS MEGERIAN
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris appeared with Lizzo on Saturday in the singer's hometown of Detroit, marking the beginning of in-person voting and lavishing the city with praise after Republican nominee Donald Trump recently disparaged it.
articles.title: Harris and Lizzo praise Detroit — in contrast to Trump — ahead of an Atlanta rally with Usher

articles.author: MICHAEL KUNZELMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Over the past four years, judges at Washington’s federal courthouse have punished hundreds of rioters who stormed the U.S. Capitol in an unprecedented assault on the nation's democracy.
articles.title: Judges punishing Jan. 6 rioters say they fear more political violence as Election Day nears

articles.author: DAVID SHARP and NICK PERRY
articles.description: Some 200,000 mail carriers have reached a tentative contract deal with the U.S. Postal Service that includes backdated pay raises and a promise to provide workers with air-conditioned trucks.
articles.title: Mail carriers reach tentative contract with USPS that includes pay raises and air-conditioned trucks

articles.author: SAMYA KULLAB
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — France's foreign minister pledged his support for Ukraine’s plan for ending the war with Russia, telling reporters in Kyiv on Saturday that he would work with Ukrainian officials to secure other nations’ backing for the proposal.
articles.title: France vows support for Ukraine's plan to end Russian invasion

articles.author: NICHOLAS RICCARDI
articles.description: LEWISVILLE, Texas (AP) — Deep in the heart of Texas' sprawl, the city of Lewisville embodies the Lone Star State.Bisected by Interstate 35 and ribboned with six- and eight-lane thoroughfares lined with chain stores, Mexican restaurants and pawn shops, Lewisville, 23 miles north of Dallas, is the prototypical slice of the nation's second most populous state.
articles.title: Two Texas cities represent the divide between those who vote and those who could, but often don't

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI and JOSH BOAK
articles.description: MESA, Ariz. (AP) — Karl Peterson has been living the cruel inverse of the American dream. His rent keeps getting higher, but his apartments keep getting smaller.Peterson left the Midwest nine years ago for the epicenter of an economic boom, only to gradually learn that endless sunshine and desert views are increasingly among the few bargains left in Arizona.
articles.title: American despair: In Arizona, high home prices and limited prospects shape voters' presidential pick

articles.author: MARK KENNEDY
articles.description: CLEVELAND (AP) — The Rock & Roll Hall Fame induction ceremony on Saturday night promises to be starry, jamming — and bittersweet.
articles.title: Rock & Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony has a poignant vibe this year
